title: Coronation Street: Viewers are left in TEARS as Sinead Tinker admits her death is near
text:
Coronation Street viewers were struggling to contain their emotions on Wednesday night as Sinead Tinker admitted her final days were near.

After a family picnic tested her strength to its limits, Sinead admitted to her husband Daniel Osbourne she's 'on the home stretch' just days after being told by doctors that she had just weeks to live.

The scenes left viewers on the brink of tears as they took to social media to reflect on the heart-wrenching storyline, which will conclude next week when Sinead finally loses her battle with cervical cancer.

Sad: Coronation Street viewers were struggling to contain their emotions on Wednesday night as Sinead Osbourne admitted her final days were near

In Wednesday's double-bill Daniel (played by Rob Mallard) and the rest of Sinead's family planned a small picnic, as they tried to pack as many memories as they could into her final days.

Despite her fading strength, Sinead (Katie McGlynn) was determined to enjoy the day but after standing up to take part in a game of charades, she was violently sick.

Daniel quickly carried his wife home, as it became clear she was growing weaker by the day.

In an emotional closing scene, the couple settled down to watch a film with their baby son Bertie, although Sinead admitted she would probably only have the strength to watch half.

Tragic: After a family picnic put her strength to the test, Sinead was taken home by her husband Daniel, where she said she was 'on the home stretch'

Following a light-hearted conversation about popcorn, Sinead told her husband: 'Crisps drive me mad at the cinema. That's something I won't have to put up with anymore.'

"Don't say that," Daniel responded, but as a tear trickled down her face Sinead admitted: 'Silver linings. We're on the home stretch,'

The episode ended on a sombre note, as Daniel held their son close and said: 'I know we are.'

Hard: After being told that she had just weeks to live, Sinead was sick during a family picnic, and she finally told Daniel that her death was imminent

Emotional: Despite trying to keep it together for his wife, Daniel couldn't hide his own emotions, as viewers will see Sinead pass away next week

Viewers were on the brink of tears as they rushed to social media to reflect on the heart-wrenching moments.

One posted: 'So heavy going but so exceptionally portrayed! A story that needs telling, that's for sure. Superb acting.'

Another wrote: 'Sinead makes me cry, I still want to hug her [sic],' while a third added: 'I love Sinead, Daniel and baby Bertie scenes. I'm gonna cry at next weeks episodes. @KatiexMcGlynn & @Rob_Mallard are phenomenal with this storyline.'

Distraught: Emotional viewers took to social media through their tears to praise soap bosses for tackling the issue storyline, while also admitting they struggled to watch the sad scenes

One fans also posted: 'Sinead and Daniels scenes are so sad. Talking about such small things we take for granted, makes you realise how lucky you are.'

Another added: 'Sinead is so brave ''we're on the home straight'' my heart goes out to her and Daniel, even tho it's a story.'

Next week Corrie fans will say goodbye to Sinead, as she passes away in a scene that is expected to leave viewers in tears.

But her final days are not without drama, as a devastated Daniel kisses Bethany Platt (Lucy Fallon) in the midst of trying to drink away his pain.

While he does come clean to his wife before her passing, she forgives him before dying peacefully with son Bertie at her side.

Coronation Street continues on Friday at 7:30pm and 8:30pm. Sinead's final scenes will air on Friday 25th October at 7:30pm on ITV.
